t: Psalm 72
Of Solomon.
Endow*pn the king with your justice, O God, the*ld royal son with your righteousness.
May*ln he judge your people in righteousness, your*ld afflicted ones with justice.
May*pn the mountains bring prosperity to the people, the*ld hills the fruit of righteousness.
May*ln he defend the afflicted among the people and*ld save the children of the needy; may*ld he crush the oppressor.
May*ln he endure as long as the sun, as*ld long as the moon, through all generations.
May*ln he be like rain falling on a mown field, like*ld showers watering the earth.
In*ln his days may the righteous flourish and*ld prosperity abound till the moon is no more.
May*pn he rule from sea to sea and*ld from the River to the ends of the earth.
May*ln the desert tribes bow before him and*ld his enemies lick the dust.
May*ln the kings of Tarshish and of distant shores bring*ld tribute to him. May*ln the kings of Sheba and Seba present*ld him gifts.
May*ln all kings bow down to him and*ld all nations serve him.
For*pn he will deliver the needy who cry out, the*ld afflicted who have no one to help.
He*ln will take pity on the weak and the needy and*ld save the needy from death.
He*ln will rescue them from oppression and violence, for*ld precious is their blood in his sight.
Long*pn may he live! May*ld gold from Sheba be given him. May*ln people ever pray for him and*ld bless him all day long.
May*ln grain abound throughout the land; on*ld the tops of the hills may it sway. May*ln the crops flourish like Lebanon and*ld thrive like the grass of the field.
May*ln his name endure forever; may*ld it continue as long as the sun. Then*pn all nations will be blessed through him, and*ld they will call him blessed.
Praise*pn be to the Lord*s God, the God of Israel, who*ld alone does marvelous deeds.
Praise*ln be to his glorious name forever; may*ld the whole earth be filled with his glory. Amen*lc and Amen.
This*pn concludes the prayers of David son of Jesse.
